basics.name: Yejun Jang
basics.label: AI Researcher
basics.summary: AI researcher and pre-founder of mutual, building trust infrastructure for the post-AI media era. Research focus on developing reinforcement learning agents that can make reliable decisions based on grounded factual information, bridging advanced decision-making algorithms with trustworthy information infrastructure. Currently pursuing B.S. in Electrical and Computer Engineering at Seoul National University.

publications.name: Q-Guided Flow Q-Learning
publications.summary: Authors: Yejun Jang, Hong Chul Nam, Jeong Min Park, Gimin Bae, Hyun Kwon. An RL training framework mathematically equivalent to the recently popularized Flow Q-Learning, but with decoupled actor and critic training for improved computational efficiency and quicker hyperparameter tuning.

publications.name: Exploring the Structure and Hyperparameters of a DQN Model for Penetration Testing on Large-Scale Networks
publications.publisher: Symposium of the Korean Institute of Communications and Information Sciences (KICS)
publications.summary: Authors: Yejun Jang, Jihun Shin, Janghyong Lee. Investigation of Deep Q-Network architectures and hyperparameter configurations for automated penetration testing.

publications.name: Preventing Model and Data Poisoning Attacks on Military AI Systems via Supply Chain Verification Techniques
publications.publisher: Conference on Information Security and Cryptography Winter 2024 (CISC-W)
publications.summary: Authors: Yejun Jang, Rocky Kim, Yeongwha Lee. Research on securing military AI systems against adversarial attacks through supply chain verification.

publications.name: Living Ideas from Future Observers (미래 관찰자의 살아있는 아이디어)
publications.summary: Book authored by the Institute for Future Strategy of Seoul National University. Participated as an editor and contributor.

publications.name: A Study on Real-Time Feedback System for Forward Head Posture Using Markerless Skeletal Tracking
publications.publisher: International Science and Engineering Fair (ISEF) - Finalist
publications.summary: Authors: Yejun Jang, Sunjin Kim. Developed a contactless feedback system using computer vision to detect and correct Forward Head Posture, achieving 81% improvement.

work.name: mutual
work.summary: Building trust infrastructure for the post-AI media era through hardware-rooted content authenticity.
highlights: Designing SRA (Signing Right Away), a hardware-rooted architecture for C2PA-aligned content authenticity
Integrating authenticated encryption and secure camera pipelines between image sensors and trusted execution environments
Raised angel investment from Kay Kyungsik Woo (MVL Foundation) to support FPGA prototyping and hardware development

work.name: Republic of Korea Army, Innovation Institute for Future Army (IIFA)
work.summary: Mandatory military service as a Military Science & Technology Researcher, focusing on AI security and deep reinforcement learning applications for military systems.
highlights: Conducted research on AI security, focusing on model and data poisoning attacks on military AI systems
Investigated deep reinforcement learning applications for penetration testing on large-scale networks
Presented research findings at national conferences (KICS 2025, CISC-W 2024)
Led work that resulted in publications at KICS 2025 and CISC-W 2024 on DQN-based penetration testing and supply chain verification for military AI systems

work.name: KAIST ACSS Lab
highlights: Explored applications of group equivariant neural networks for multi-agent traffic optimization
Investigated traffic light control systems using multi-agent reinforcement learning
Gained experience in symmetry-aware neural network architectures and their applications to real-world problems

work.name: Korea Foundation for Advanced Studies (KFAS)
work.position: Project Head, SOUL - A Modern Reinterpretation of Keynes' Bancor
work.summary: Modeled international trade using multi-agent reinforcement learning to simulate Keynes' International Clearing Union.
highlights: Modeled central banks of each country as an RL agent aiming to maximize annual GDP in a simulated global economy
Explored economic policy and international relations through game-theoretic and multi-agent simulations
Secured funding of 10 million KRW (~$10,000 CAD) and managed allocation for computing, mentoring, and resources

work.name: KFAS & Institute for Future Strategy, Seoul National University
work.summary: Branstormed impactful keyphrases capturing the essence of the digital society.
highlights: Coined the phrase “attention ownership” – the right to control, manage, and determine how one's attention is directed.
Book published with title 'Living Ideas from Future Observers (미래 관찰자의 살아있는 아이디어)', available for purchase throughout Korean bookstores.

work.name: Sejong Academy of Science and Arts (SASA)
work.summary: Built a contactless feedback system for alerting incorrect body posture when using digital devices.
highlights: Developed a measurement criterion for Forward Head Posture (FHP) using computer vision techniques
Processing 3D webcam data and providing audio feedback led to 81% improvement in participants' FHP
Became 2020 Regeneron ISEF finalist

courses: Research Focus: Deep Reinforcement Learning, Generative Models, AI Safety

education.institution: Sejong Academy of Science and Arts (SASA)

scholarships.name: KFAS Injaerim Scholarship Program
scholarships.summary: $5,000/year + $10,000 maximum project fund per team. Attended critical thinking, communication and negotiation strategy programs.

scholarships.name: KAIST Science Talent Scholar
scholarships.issuer: Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology

skills.name: Deep Learning & AI
keywords: Reinforcement Learning: Offline RL, Multi-agent RL, Deep Q-Learning, Policy Gradient Methods
Generative Models: Flow Matching, Normalizing Flows, VAE, GAN
Deep Learning: Sequential Models (LSTM, Transformers), Function Approximation
AI Security: Adversarial Attacks, Model Poisoning, Supply Chain Security

skills.name: Libraries & Frameworks
keywords: PyTorch, JAX, huggingface, NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Docker, Git, uv
RL: PettingZoo, Gymnasium (OpenAI Gym), RLlib, CleanRL, trl

skills.name: Research & Communication
keywords: Technical Writing, Academic Research, Conference Presentations

projects.name: Signing Right Away (SRA)
projects.summary: Hardware-rooted trust architecture for verifiable digital provenance and content authenticity, forming the core of mutual's SRA (Signing Right Away) system.
highlights: Designed hardware-rooted trust architecture for verifiable digital provenance and C2PA-aligned content authenticity
Developed authenticated encryption scheme (e.g., AES-GCM/CCM) for securing camera-to-processor image data
Proposed TEE-based immediate signing to combat AI-generated fake content
Raised angel investment to fund FPGA-based prototyping and secure camera pipeline development

projects.name: QuPid - VR Quantum Computing Education
projects.summary: Created a VR laboratory to explain basic but hard-to-grasp concepts in quantum computing, specifically the qubit.
highlights: Virtual Reality
Educational Technology
Quantum Computing

projects.name: Car-The-Garden - Autonomous Navigation
projects.summary: Applied left-first and right-first search algorithms to navigate a miniature version of the standard Korean driving test.
highlights: Autonomous Navigation
Search Algorithms
Robotics

volunteer.summary: Translated multiple educational articles in the Raspberry Pi Foundation's Project page to Korean.
Assist community engagement programs and teach math and science to community members.
